title: Nursing Care for Infants with Congenital Heart Disease: Comparing E-Learning and Classroom Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Advanced blended learning program for practicing nurses conducted in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain physiological characteristics and nursing interventions for infants with congenital heart disease.
Learners can apply preoperative and postoperative infant nursing procedures through simulation or case analysis.
Learners can compare the strengths and weaknesses of e-learning and classroom-based instruction to select methods suitable for their learning environment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
